tool.name: Local QCs viewer
tool.command: #if $command.cmd == "localqc" galaxy.py gviewer '$infile' '$locqctable' -g '$genome' -o '$report' --resolution '$command.resolution' --nregions '$command.nregions' --filename '${infile.name}' '$nodup' #elif $command.cmd == "genes" galaxy.py gviewer '$infile' '$locqctable' -g '$genome' -o '$report' --resolution '$command.resolution' --genes '$command.genes' --filename '${infile.name}' '$nodup' #else galaxy.py gviewer '$infile' '$locqctable' -g '$genome' -o '$report' --regions '$regions' --filename '${infile.name}' '$nodup' #end if

param.name: nregions
param.label: Number of regions
param.help: Indicate the number of regions to be displayed (Min: 0, max: 25, default: 10).

param.name: genes
param.label: Genes
param.help: List of genes (one per line). Max: 25.

param.name: regions
param.label: Genomic regions
param.help: List of genomic regions (one per line).Format: chr:start-end. Max: 25.

tool.help:
**What it does**
This tool displays read-counts intensity profiles illustrated in the context of its corresponding local QC indicators (heatmap; from 0 to 10% read-counts intensity dispersion). The lower the dispersion, the better is the robustness quality of the genomic region in view and, as illustrated, it correlates well with the enrichment patterns. The y-axis corresponds to read-count intensity levels and the x-axis to genomic coordinates. Blue bars depict annotated genes when present in the region shown.
-----
**Options**
One can select genomic regions to be displayed by using:
1. the dispersion stored in the local QC file (regions with the lowest dispersion will be selected) 2. a list of genes. For each gene, a genomic region will be selected, using the given gene's start position as center.
The resolution (number of base pairs) can be selected.
PCR duplicates reads can be discarded if desired.
------
**Output**
Genomic regions are embedded in a PDF report.
------
This tool is part of the NGS-QC Generator from the `Sysfate laboratory`__.
.. __: https://www.sysfate.org/
